model.description: A device has been repeatedly connecting to a rare external location with a beacon score. A beacon score is added when Darktrace identifies that a device is regularly communicating with an endpoint, for example, if a device connects to a rare external endpoint every 12 minutes this would get a beacon score. This model is designed to identify beaconing at a lower threshold and be protocol agnostic.\n\nAction: Review the external domains and IPs being connected to to see if they are legitimate and would be expected for business purposes.
model.name: Compromise::Beaconing Activity To External Rare

rule.author: System
rule.description: A device has been repeatedly connecting to a rare external location with a beacon score. A beacon score is added when Darktrace identifies that a device is regularly communicating with an endpoint, for example, if a device connects to a rare external endpoint every 12 minutes this would get a beacon score. This model is designed to identify beaconing at a lower threshold and be protocol agnostic.\n\nAction: Review the external domains and IPs being connected to to see if they are legitimate and would be expected for business purposes.
rule.name: Compromise::Beaconing Activity To External Rare
